content.raw:
I've made a refactor of the GenericMail class and the default behaviour is:

 * It filters ([as detailed in the extended-mail page](https://wiki.jenkins-ci.org/display/JENKINS/Email-ext+Recipes#Email-extRecipes-FilterRecipientsOnDomain)) the non OSRF addresses by default for current existing jobs. See the [test job](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/mentor2-ci-default-trusty-amd64/configure)  (Advanced options in the email config).
 * These jobs were we have external contributors can override this when defining the jobs (see ros_debian.dsl in this PR and the [test job](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_debian_science-ci-default-sid-amd64/configure))

I've made a refactor of the GenericMail class and the default behaviour is:

  • It filters (as detailed in the extended-mail page) the non OSRF addresses by default for current existing jobs. See the test job (Advanced options in the email config).
  • These jobs were we have external contributors can override this when defining the jobs (see ros_debian.dsl in this PR and the test job)
